result.execSummary:
The defendant MATTHEW ANTHONY YOUNG was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
42 days credit if revoked. 
22CF65 dismissed and read in.
Concurrent with: 21CF462

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Cash bond applied. Remaining balance due 7/18/2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Restitution represents $300 plus $30 surcharge. 
Cash bond applied.

Complete a psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations. 
Any other assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with Victim 1 and Victim 2 in case, 21CF462.
No contact with Officer McLaughlin and Officer Weinke unless in the court of their official duties as police officers. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MATTHEW A YOUNG in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder in court for MATTHEW A YOUNG. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
21CF462, Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; however, court acquiesces to DAGP for 36 months and plea is not accepted at this time. 
Amended Count 2, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Count 3, Domestic, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Amended Count 4, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Count 5, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
22CF63, Count 2, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found.  
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

21CF462, Count 6 DRI. 
22CF63, Counts 1, 3, & 4 DRI. 
22CF65 DRI.

Court orders: 

If successful, Count 1 to be dismissed. 

Withheld sentence, 36 months probation, concurrent
No contact with Victim 1 and 2 in 21CF462.

Psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations
